name: Vegan Sweet Potato Chili
recipeIngredient: 2 cups drained and rinsed kidney beans

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 5 tablespoons vegetable broth in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir onion, garlic, and jalapeno pepper in the hot broth until slightly tender, about 5 minutes. Add sweet potatoes, chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, and red pepper flakes to onion mixture. Pour remaining 2 cups vegetable broth over sweet potato mixture.

Bring vegetable broth mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium, and simmer until sweet potatoes are tender, 20 to 25 minutes. Stir tomatoes and kidney beans into sweet potato mixture and simmer over low heat until flavors have blended, about 45 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Blown away!! Hands down one of the best chili's I've ever ate. Used 1 can kidney and 1 can black beans, added some bell pepper, used all organic ingredients. The Jalapeño and smoked paprika really make the dish something special. This one's definitely a keeper and that's a first so far since becoming vegetarian. Thanks a lot stephlee12!!

Very tasty! Who would have thought vegan dishes can be delicious. You won't miss the meat in it! I used homegrown jalapeno pepper, sweet potatoes and tomatoes, which made me happy to be able to use produce from my garden. Made about 1.5 of the recipe. I didn't have vegetable broth on hand and substituted with vegetable base Better Than Bouillon", combination of kidney beans, black beans, and pinto beans. No where in the instruction when to put tomato paste in, so I put it in with the sweet potatoes and spices. I also added a can of drained sweet corn at the end to balance the spices and heat. It turned out very good, nice and thick! Husband loved it as well. Thanks for the recipe. It's a keeper!

I will definitely make it again. My family and I are new o the vegan life and this was so tasty it didn't leave me missing meat. I made some changes however : no jalapeño,  I used weet  bell peppers instead and only a few, I also used 1 can of black beans vs the suggested kidney kind, I used 2 fresh cut up tomatoes,  and a can of tomato paste, and organic corn too give it more sweetness  for my toddlers. together it took about 30 min I served it with brown rice and avocado.

engl219.J.L.

Let me start with this. I am an avid meat eater, hamburgers, hot dogs, Texas Roadhouse’s “fall of the bone ribs”; I eat it all. Then one day we had a party and guess what! It was all vegan. Have I ever had something vegan? No. Did I ever think that I really would? Not really.  But let me tell you something; this chili is amazing.  I was kinda skeptical but when I tried it they actually were not that bad. This chili tasted like any other chili that I had had beside it being meatless. 
I do not like sweet potatoes, and in this recipe there are a lot of them. They were used as the meat substitute. However, you couldn’t even really tell that they were in there. They were not to sweet and they soaked up all of the flavor of the rest of the chili. 
The base of the chili was really good. It has a few different types of beans and many vegetables. Also, if you cook it right it is not a watery chili. Let's be honest, who wants a watery chili. But, it also was not a super thick chili. All of the different veggies in it all went together perfectly. 
The chili wasn’t too spicy but it also was not bland. It had a perfect balance of spicy and savory with just a hint of sweet from the sweet potatoes. To garnish it, it says you can put in cheese and sorry cream. But this was a vegan party so we did vegan sour cream and vegan cheese which was just as good.
This chili was amazing. With its accents of different flavors but also the balance of flavors. It smelled amazing and that me
This is spicy and sweet! It's a great combination! Thanks for the recipe!

I made this using my slow cooker for a chili cook off at work.  It won hands down!!!  Added Beyond Beef crumbles so folks could have a little heartier chili.  To everyone’s surprise when I told them it was 100% vegan!  Will definitely make this again.
Amazing!!! Changes i had to make due to supply was curry instead of cumin hot sauce instead of red pepper flakes and banana peppers instead of jalapeños. I will follow any recipe this person posts!
I made this for a group that included vegans vegetarians gluten-free and carnivores. Big hit!!!

I just got finishing making this dish and I really like it. I used sweet peppers instead of hot ones since I dislike really spicy foods and it turned out good.:) Plus me and my husband are vegetarians and my mom is a Vegan so I'm very happy this will keep everyone happy.:3
It just didn't do it for me or my family.
